name: Leptoceras Butterwort
description: Pinguicula leptoceras is a small carnivorous plant native to Europe, particularly in alpine and subarctic regions. It belongs to the Lentibulariaceae family and features a compact rosette of sticky, bright green leaves (2-4 cm long) that secrete mucilage to trap and digest insects. The leaves curl inward when an insect is trapped, increasing contact area for digestion. The plant displays a rosette-forming growth habit and typically reaches 3-6 cm in height. It produces beautiful violet or purple flowers in summer. In its native habitat, it grows in nutrient-poor, wet soils in bogs and alpine meadows. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant offers unique intrigue with its rosette form and attractive flowers. It's popular among carnivorous plant enthusiasts for its cold tolerance and colorful blooms.
careTips: Requires distilled or rain water only
